articles.headline: A Job That Isn’t Hard to Get in a Pandemic: Swindlers’ Unwitting Helper
articles.snippet: Criminals are increasingly using people like Denise Newton to move their money, just as many have lost their jobs and are vulnerable.
articles.abstract: Criminals are increasingly using people like Denise Newton to move their money, just as many have lost their jobs and are vulnerable.
articles.lead_paragraph: After the fitness center where Denise Newton worked closed down in April because of the coronavirus, she posted her résumé online to look for a new job. She soon got a call from a company she had never heard of.

articles.headline: Breonna Taylor’s Family to Receive $12 Million Settlement From City of Louisville
articles.snippet: In the aftermath of the botched police raid in which Ms. Taylor was killed, the city also agreed to institute changes aimed at preventing future deaths by officers.
articles.abstract: In the aftermath of the botched police raid in which Ms. Taylor was killed, the city also agreed to institute changes aimed at preventing future deaths by officers.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky. — After months of protests that turned Breonna Taylor’s name into a national slogan against police violence, city officials agreed to pay her family $12 million and institute changes aimed at preventing future deaths by officers.

articles.headline: Israel, U.A.E. and Bahrain Sign Accords, With an Eager Trump Playing Host
articles.snippet: President Trump said the agreements to normalize relations marked “the dawn of a new Middle East,” but some analysts said his claims were overblown.
articles.abstract: President Trump said the agreements to normalize relations marked “the dawn of a new Middle East,” but some analysts said his claims were overblown.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Israel and two Arab nations signed agreements at the White House on Tuesday to normalize their relations, a step toward a realignment of the Middle East but one that failed to address the future of the Palestinians.

articles.headline: Movie Theaters Returned. Audiences Didn’t. Now What?
articles.snippet: People aren’t going to the movies at anywhere close to the numbers that Hollywood hoped, prompting studios to postpone more big releases. Marvel’s “Black Widow” could be the next to retreat.
articles.abstract: People aren’t going to the movies at anywhere close to the numbers that Hollywood hoped, prompting studios to postpone more big releases. Marvel’s “Black Widow” could be the next to retreat.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — “Tenet” was supposed to mark the return of the movie theater business in the United States. Instead, it has shown just how much trouble the industry is in.
articles.byline: By Nicole Sperling and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: Hurricane Sally Is a Slow-Moving Threat. Climate Change Might Be Why.
articles.snippet: Scientists say that climate change, which has also contributed to the wildfires on the West Coast, helped intensify a storm that is unleashing a deluge in Florida, Alabama and Mississippi.
articles.abstract: Scientists say that climate change, which has also contributed to the wildfires on the West Coast, helped intensify a storm that is unleashing a deluge in Florida, Alabama and Mississippi.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Follow our live Hurricane Sally updates and our map tracker.]
articles.byline: By Richard Fausset, Rick Rojas and Henry Fountain

articles.headline: House Report Condemns Boeing and F.A.A. in 737 Max Disasters
articles.snippet: A committee’s Democrats say two fatal crashes were a “horrific culmination” of engineering flaws, mismanagement and oversight lapses.
articles.abstract: A committee’s Democrats say two fatal crashes were a “horrific culmination” of engineering flaws, mismanagement and oversight lapses.
articles.lead_paragraph: The two crashes that killed 346 people aboard Boeing’s 737 Max and led to the worldwide grounding of the plane were the “horrific culmination” of engineering flaws, mismanagement and a severe lack of federal oversight, the Democratic majority on the House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee said in a report on Wednesday.

articles.headline: How Does the Federal Eviction Moratorium Work? It Depends Where You Live
articles.snippet: From state to state, and even judge to judge, a simple-sounding order by the C.D.C. on eviction cases is open to interpretation.
articles.abstract: From state to state, and even judge to judge, a simple-sounding order by the C.D.C. on eviction cases is open to interpretation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Fending off an eviction could depend on which judge a renter in financial trouble is given, despite a federal government order intended to protect renters at risk of being turned out.

articles.headline: Europe’s Economic Revival Is Imperiled, Raising the Specter of a Grinding Downturn
articles.snippet: As the coronavirus regains force, economists fear that Europe’s tentative recovery is at risk from traditional political concerns.
articles.abstract: As the coronavirus regains force, economists fear that Europe’s tentative recovery is at risk from traditional political concerns.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Europe was supposedly done with political histrionics. In the face of the pandemic, a continent not known for common purpose had put aside long-festering national suspicions to forge a collective economic rescue, raising hopes that a sustainable recovery was underway.
articles.byline: By Peter S. Goodman and Liz Alderman

articles.headline: Why Unemployment Claims May Be Overcounted by Millions
articles.snippet: Weekly tallies of jobless claims were not meant to be treated as an economic indicator. The pandemic has exposed the shortcomings of doing so.
articles.abstract: Weekly tallies of jobless claims were not meant to be treated as an economic indicator. The pandemic has exposed the shortcomings of doing so.
articles.lead_paragraph: Economic statistics were never designed to measure the sudden shutdown and restart of large segments of the U.S. economy. Still, if there is one question that the government seemingly should be able to answer, it is this: How many Americans are receiving unemployment benefits?

articles.headline: Her Husband Abused Her. But Getting a Divorce Was an Ordeal.
articles.snippet: A graphic video of a husband beating his wife has shocked China, shedding light on the prevalence of domestic violence and the difficulties of obtaining a divorce.
articles.abstract: A graphic video of a husband beating his wife has shocked China, shedding light on the prevalence of domestic violence and the difficulties of obtaining a divorce.
articles.lead_paragraph: The husband and wife were alone in her boutique, but the security cameras captured it all: him pushing her down, punching her, slapping her and dragging her by the hair across the floor.
